instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fast fan
threads.message:
Originally arrived liquid damaged. After repairing board everything worked perfect.

2 months later itâ€™s returned for fast fan spin. So far tried known good trackpad and cable. Replaced <CHIP>U5511</CHIP> <TRANSISTOR>Q5050</TRANSISTOR> and <TRANSISTOR>Q5520</TRANSISTOR>. Continuity from <TRANSISTOR>Q5520</TRANSISTOR> to <CHIP>U5511</CHIP> is good. <RESISTOR>R5511</RESISTOR> and <RESISTOR>R5522</RESISTOR> both measure the same 9.8 ohms.

what needs to be checked next? See picture for details

threads.message: Check voltage and diode mode to ground on SCL/SDA lines of <CHIP>U5511</CHIP>.

<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> fast fan
threads.message:
The communication on SMLink 1 is affected; there is not one sensor issue.
If you change all possible, then remains SMC, PCH  and CPUone of them block that I2C bus.

<RESISTOR>R5510</RESISTOR> is good?
